MASTER MANIPULATOR.Definition: someone skilled at influencing or controlling others

LOOSE MORALS.Definition: lack of ethical or moral principles

STIGMA.Definition: a negative perception or mark of disgrace

UNTAPPED MARKET.Definition: a previously undiscovered or unexplored group of consumers

CHARGED WITH.Definition: tasked with a that responsibility or duty

DRUMMING UP.Definition: creating interest or support through promotion or publicity

RESONATE.Definition: cause a strong emotional response or similarity of feeling

PATRIOTIC.Definition: showing strong love or loyalty to their country

PICKED UP THE MANTLE.Definition: taken responsibilities or roles previously held by men

TURNED OUT.Definition: was discovered or revealed to be the case

WEAKER SEX.Definition: the belief suggesting women were less capable than men

LEGISLATORS.Definition: people who made or enacted laws

EXCEPTION.Definition: something that didn't agree with that rule or standard

PUFFING ON.Definition: inhaling and exhaling smoke from a cigarette

TORCH.Definition: something that serves to illuminate, enlighten, or guide

EMANCIPATION.Definition: the act of being set free or liberated from oppression

STROLLED.Definition: walked casually or at a leisurely pace

PUBLICITY STUNT.Definition: planned action or event designed to attract public attention

IRRATIONALITY.Definition: the state of being illogical or unreasonable

CARBOHYDRATE.Definition: food consisting of sugar or starch, that provides the body with energy

INHERENT.Definition: inborn or existing as a natural part

ATTACK VECTOR.Definition: method or means used to achieve his goal

FROM THE STANDPOINT OF.Definition: from the perspective or viewpoint of

CARRIED OUT.Definition: performed the task, put it into action

CONCURRED.Definition: agreed or expressed the same opinion

MIND BENDING.Definition: having a strong effect on people's minds
